Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kevin Malone, you're next. Spit that out. [Kevin shoves the rest of the donut he's eating into his mouth] Spit... Okay, come on, let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You look cute today, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thanks, girl.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, yesterday Dwight found half a joint in the parking lot. Which is unfortunate because as it turns out, Dwight finding drugs is more dangerous than most people using drugs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's go over some of the symptoms of marijuana use, shall we? You tell me who this sounds like: slow moving, inattentive, dull, constantly snacking, shows a lack of motivation.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [nods] Hey...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I like the people I work with generally, with four exceptions. But someone committed a crime and I did not become a Lackawanna County Volunteer Sheriff's deputy to make friends. And by the way, I haven't.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [mimicking Stanley] I enjoy the tangy zip of Miracle Whip.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs] Jim does the best impressions. Sometimes he'll look up at me from his desk and he'll just be someone else. Like he'll go um, [makes mournful face, giggles] that's supposed to be Phyllis. I can't do it as good as he can.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: And the guys are saying, chug, chug, chug, but I'm so small and all I'd eaten that day was one of those Auntie Anne pretzels from the food court so I said "Is it okay if I sip it?" and they said no, but Ryan seemed cool either way.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stop! This is not Kelly Kapoor story hour. Illegal drugs were consumed on company property, okay? Your ass is on the line, mister! My ass is is on the line! Now I'm going to ask you again. What time did you go home last night?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Six.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I didn't know that you were at a party on Saturday night.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I go to a lot of parties.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm gonna need to search your car. Give me you keys.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I am not giving you my keys.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't make me do this the hard way.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What's the hard way?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I go down to the police station on my lunch break. I tell a police officer, I know several, what I suspect you may have in your car. He requests a hearing from a judge and obtains a search warrant, once he has said warrant, he will drive over here, and make you give him the keys to your car, and you will have to obey him.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, let's do it that way.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ry, is he bugging you? Dwight, dude, you gotta take a chill pill, man. It was one joint in the parking lot. You know, you're totally harshing the office mellow.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can't stop this investigation. It is my job.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoa. You are a volunteer.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I volunteered for this job.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And that's not the same.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It is my duty...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [interrupting] Volunteer duty.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...to investigate the crime scene. I have six more interviews to go and then I will reveal what I know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [fake coughing] Narc!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [giggling]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If you are attempting to compliment me then you have done a very good job.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I wasn't attempting to compliment you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, you have...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uuf, well...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...because being a narc is one of the hardest jobs that you can have...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [shakes head] Okay...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...and I am very proud of being a narc.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why don't you just cool it, cool it Dwight, please, God! [to Jim] Dude, where's my office? [Jim quietly laughs] I totally lost it, 'cause I was half-baked. Smokin' doobies. Doobie brothers, I was smokin' doobies with my brothers. Peace out, Seacrest!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, your office is behind you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks. M-m-munchies. Who wants some munchies?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't think Michael's ever done drugs. I don't know if anyone has ever offered him any.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oscar visited Mexico when he was five to attend his great-grandmother's funeral. What does that mean to a United States law enforcement officer? He's a potential drug mule.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Have you ever taken any illegal drugs?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No, I have not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you think it's possible that maybe you could have had some drugs in your system without you knowing about it?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What are you implying?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Have you ever... pooped... a balloon?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay. I'm done with this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He sure left in a hurry.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't want to blow this. This is what all good law enforcement officers dream of. The chance to solve an actual crime.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you know what this is? [pushing a photo toward her]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yes, it's marijuana.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How do you know that?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's labeled.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [grabs pictures back and looks at it] Dammit.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: That is Northern Lights Cannabis Indica.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, it's marijuana.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm just saying that you can't be sure that is wasn't you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's ridiculous, of course it wasn't me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Marijuana is a memory loss drug, so maybe you just don't remember.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I would remember.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, how could you, if it just erased your memory?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's not how it works.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Now how do you know how it works?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Knock it off, okay, I'm interviewing you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No! You said that I'd be conducting the interview when I walked in here. Now exactly how much pot did you smoke?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [opens eyes wide in total surprise]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: So Pam told me that you do a great Stanley impression, I'd love to hear it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, um...[mimicking Stanley] Why do you keep CC'ing me on things that have nothing to do with me? [Pam and Oscar laugh, Stanley walks in, and Oscar leaves quickly]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Is that supposed to be me?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, hey Stanley. Uh, I was just doing an impression.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I do not think that is funny.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He does everyone in the office.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Hmmmpt.

Quote.Speaker: Pam and Jim
Quote.Text: [in unison] I do not think that is funny.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jinx! Buy me a coke.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no talking. Jim is not allowed to talk until after he buys me a coke. Those are the rules of jinx, and they are unflinchingly rigid. [Jim puts money in drink machine, selection is sold out]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sold out? That has never happened in the history of jinx.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [mouths] C'mon!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sorry, that's not my problem.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [presses drink button, looks at camera, makes Jim-face]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know you're innocent, but I can't look like I'm treating you any differently.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I understand.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where were you yesterday after work?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [smiles knowingly]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh-oh. Uh-oh. Who's he calling? Ratting somebody out. Narc! Narc! Kevin?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That is so good, Michael

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Remember the narc bit? [laughs] Uh-oh, who's in trouble?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Attention everyone. Drug testers are coming in a couple of hours to test everyone's urine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Waa... what? What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Company policy. If drugs are found on the premises there is automatic drug testing conducted within twenty-four hours.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Is that true, Toby?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, when you sign your job application you agree to comply with random drug testing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Two nights ago, I went to an Alicia Keys concert at the Montage Mountain Performing Arts Center. I scored these great aisle seats. Anyway, after the opening act this beautiful girl sits down next to me and I never get to meet girls with lip rings and she had one. I don't know exactly how this happened but one of her friends started passing around some stuff and they said it was clove cigarettes, and I'm sure that it was clove cigarettes. Everybody in the aisle was doing it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, attention everyone the drug testing has been cancelled. Instead, I will be going around to each of you and doing a visual inspection.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No you can't do that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can do that, it is my office.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No you cannot. It has to be official, and it has to be urine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmmm. Ha. [under his breath] Alright. Great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kevin, what prescription drugs are you taking, besides Rogaine?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm not taking Rogaine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Angela, what about you?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't take any prescription drugs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're not on anything?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [Gives Dwight a knowing look]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: So the first time we went out to dinner, it was like, whatever, fine, but I was so nervous. So this time I wanted to be special, so I bought a new dress! [Jim hunches his shoulders and grins] One of those kinds that is kinda low cut at top to show something, but not everything. [Jim shakes his head no in agreement] I mean not everything, Jim. [Jim shakes his head in agreement] I promise, I'm not that kind of...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey guys, what's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: We're having the best conversation. [Jim, eyes wide, shakes his head, no]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, okay. Well, Michael wants to see everyone in the conference room. [Jim shakes his head. Seems relieved to be getting away from Kelly] But you know what? We have a few minutes so you guys should definitely finish up your conversation. [Jim nods his head as if to say, "Gee, thanks, Pam."]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: So, I was looking so hot...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It has come to my attention that some people here think that the use of drugs is something to laugh about.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We don't feel that way.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, not at all.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You were the one joking around calling Dwight a narc.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, uh, no. That was a test. I was testing you, and you all failed. Miserably. When I said that Dwight was a narc, how many of you defended him? How many of you said, "Hey, you know what, he's right? What he's doing is protecting this office from the evils of drugs."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am ridiculously anti-drug. So anti-drug that I am above suspicion in any way that involves suspicion, or testing of any kind.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Drugs ruin lives people. Drugs destroy careers. Take Cheech and Chong everybody knows that Cheech and Chong are funny, but just imagine how funny they would be if they didn't smoke pot. I want everybody to take a look to their left. Now I want everybody to take a look to their right. One of those people will be dead from drug use at some point in their lives. This year more people will use cocaine than will read a book to their children.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Where did you get these facts?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are these facts scaring you, or are they not?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: They are not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you think that smoking drugs is cool? Do you think that doing alcohol is cool?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No, I don't. I have a glass of red wine with dinner about once a week. For the antioxidants.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, enough, enough, enough! I have written down a list of illegal drugs. Take a gander. How many of these are you familiar with?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hookah is not an illegal drug, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes it is.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No it's not. It's a type of pipe. You can fill it with tobacco, often mixed with fruit, or other flavors.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, you know what, Toby? Pam, can you take this down? [Pam throws her hands up to indicate she has no notepad] In addition to Toby's urine being tested, I would like to test his blood and his hair.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You can't do that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can test anyone randomly, and I have chosen you randomly.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: That's not random.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, eeny, meenie, miney, moe, is random. Okay, you know what? I'm going to need a volunteer to select one of these words and tell us of something tragic that happened in either their lives, or the lives of a loved one. Yeah, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know that Jim has an amazing story about a relative of his who got caught up in the world of drugs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? [Jim shakes his head no]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, hmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim it's okay. You can t... [Jim looks at Pam and shakes his head, Pam looks at him and gestures for Jim to go up and tell his story] This would be a good place to let it out, Jim. These are people you can trust. These are people who care about you. [Jim shakes his head no] It's okay, just we will not judge you. We are here to not judge you. [Jim stands up] Oh, he's doing it, okay. [Jim looks at Pam] It's okay. [Jim pretends to try, looking teary eyed, shakes his head no, mouths "I can't" and sits back down. Pam is amazed.] Oh. Okay, are you sure? [Jim shakes his head. Kevin pats his shoulder] That looked like it was going to be good. Alright. [Pam nods in admiration at Jim] Okay, well.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow! He really pulled out the big guns. Fake crying. Did not expect that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The point I'm trying to make with all of this people is that I hate drugs. I hate them, and based upon what I have seen you all don't quite hate 'em as much as I do so you are going to have a drug test, and I am not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, you will be tested.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I will not be.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You will be. That is the law according to the rules.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, well Dwight just know that I've been very busy today and I got a lot of work to do and I wasn't planning on going to the bathroom and I don't even know if anything is going to come out, okay? So good. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hi, Linda. Dwight Schrute, Assistant Regional Manager. You might remember testing my urine a few years back when I was applying to be a volunteer sheriff's deputy.

Quote.Speaker: Linda
Quote.Text: We test a lot of urine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mine was green.

Quote.Speaker: Linda
Quote.Text: Oh, right. How are you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm all better.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So I need you to do some work on the St. Andrews account. I need your urine. I need some filing done.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What kind of filing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just forget it. Just the urine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That goes directly to the tester.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just. I need your urine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Like in a cup?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes in a cup, we're not animals, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: For what purpose?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's none of your business.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Then I refuse.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Alright. Just, I went to an Alicia Keys concert, over the weekend, and I think I may have gotten high accidentally by a girl with a lip ring.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you serious?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I need clean urine for the lady.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But that's illegal.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't think of it that way. It's like, urine goes all over the place. You know, there's no controlling it. It just... goes

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not my urine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A cup could find its way under the urine. It might be an accident. It happens.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Were you forced to do drugs at this concert?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, just look. Look. Just... just fill up the cup.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Do you want to give Michael your urine?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I want him to have all the urine he needs.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You're not going to get my permission on this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know that. Don't you think I know that?

Quote.Speaker: Linda
Quote.Text: Yeah, we do testing all over the country.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Cool. Hey, are you guys hiring?

Quote.Speaker: Linda
Quote.Text: You want to work at the urinalysis lab?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah. Maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My father's name was Dwight Schrute. My grandfather's name was Dwight Schrute. His father's name Dwide Schrude. Amish. I loved my father very much. Every morning he'd wake up at dawn and make us biscuits with gravy. When I was little my dad and I played a lot of games together. My dad cheated a lot but I never busted him on it. I would have, except I didn't know about it. He didn't tell me till years later. I was shocked when I found out.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What? [Jim shakes his head] Did you want to tell me something? You look like you want to tell me something. [Jim shakes his head no] You look like you have something really important to say and you just can't for some reason. [Jim smiles] Come on, you can tell me. Jim, you can tell me anything. [Jim stops smiling and looks down. Pam wonders what that means]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'd like a magazine.

Quote.Speaker: Linda
Quote.Text: We just need urine, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'd still like one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight. Well, I passed the test thanks to you and your untainted pee. Thank you very much.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's wrong? Where's your costume?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a uniform and I turned it in today when I tendered my resignation.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why? Wha...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I took an oath when I was sworn in and I broke that oath today.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [placing a coke can in front of Jim] Here. [Jim looks confused] Just buy it from me. I haven't talked to you in hours and it's been weird and I really want to know what the hell's going on with Dwight. [Pam scoots the coke can towards Jim. Jim pulls out his wallet and hands Pam a dollar. He gives the coke back to Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How much time do you have left on your break?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ten minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Since you did such a good job with the investigation, I decided to pull a few strings. Call in a few favors. and I've decided to make you official security supervisor of the branch.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's fantastic because I've always felt that the security here sucked .

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So you wanna? Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Dwight K. Schrute, I hereby declare you an honorary voluntary corporal in charge of assisting all activities security.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Here's your badge.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you, Michael. Very nice. Great. [To Hank] Can I have a gun?

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: No, I don't have a gun.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, I'll have to bring in my bow staff.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [salutes] Thank you, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. Oh. Uh...[awkwardly salutes]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I need to go over some details with you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright. [to Hank] Well, Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: First of all, Hank, how many orange traffic cones do you have?

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Two.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, God.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. What a terrible day to not be able to talk. Dwight was literally carrying around his own urine and dressed like one of the Village People. Why does he do the things that he does for Michael? I just don't get it. What is he getting out of that relationship?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [growling] Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do someone else.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um, [gives Pam a look]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The eyebrow.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm not only hoping to find the culprit who committed this heinous crime, I am praying to find this heinous culprit. And I will pray to Thor himself, if that's what it takes.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael's behavior is erratic and unpredictable, but I don't think he's doing drugs. Maybe he should. Take the edge off. Uh, not at work, of course.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: People use marijuana to escape. Jim does not have a girlfriend. His sales are nothing to brag about. And he does not belong to any organized clubs. If that were my life, I'd do drugs.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: He asked if you've been acting withdrawn lately.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: And what did you say?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I said no.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Your turn, Stanley. [Stanley just takes a drink from his mug] Angela, you're up.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Last night? Let's see.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Go ahead. Don't lie.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I won't. It's just that last night is really hard for me to remember because I was just a teensy bit high. Should I have not said that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no. It's okay. Go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know that I shouldn't have done it. But I was in the parking lot at the Quick and Easy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And I took a bong hit from my Bong Water with my pimp.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Pam said you had something important to tell me. Is it bad? Am I getting fired? [Jim shakes head 'no'] Why aren't you telling me? It must be bad. They're taking away my kid. I knew it. [Jim waves arms and shakes head 'no'] They're not taking away my kid. Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, sure, I can definitely help you with that. Okay? Please hold.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Kelly Kapour. Say your prayers. Let's go. Conference room, pronto. Come on, step it up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Drugs are everywhere in our society. They are omniscient. If you look at the amount of pot that was smoked in the United States last year, that would reach the moon.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: How?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Exactly. I know. It's amazing.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No, how could it reach the moon? Like, would you make it into a rope, or...

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I have some hemp ropes at my house, they're really strong...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shut... Shut it. No. Just... Just focus on the facts. Cocaine. They use cocaine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, me? Just one of the gang. Sitting in the back, doodling, not playing attention. Bam! Pow! Surprise! Got you! [Note pad reads, "Creed -Shifty eyes / Ryan - Dilated pupils / Kelly - Hyperactive"] There's a Volunteer Sheriff's Deputy in your midst, and he is taking names.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: One thing that you need to remember is that there's no way of knowing who's a user, who's an abuser, because we don't know. It could be anybody. Your instinct is to say it's somebody-like Stanley or Oscar...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no! Your instinct. That... Your gut reaction is to say that, but I don't! That's, that's... Those are instincts that have been created by media and hype. And they are wrong. What I am saying is that you just do not know who drug users are. It may be the person you least suspect. It may be somebody hot, like Pam, or it could be somebody matronly, like Phyllis, but just not me.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's not me, either.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No? okay, fine.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Michael, I'm gonna get going. I really don't think I need to be in this meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, well, I really think that... [dial tone beeping]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Has she been on the phone the whole time?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Sorry you had to hear that. It was a lovers' quarrel.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Make-up sex. Nice!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, let's get personal for a second, shall we?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The scary thing is, it could have been any one of these people. They all had a motive. To get high.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, well, I made up some fliers for everybody to take on your way out, in case you're ever tempted. So there you go. And, Dwight, you know, I'm very busy today. It wasn't even planning on going to the bathroom, so I don't even know if anything will come out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: just drink a lot of water.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You have to relax your muscles around the bladder.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't... Let's just not talk about it, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [reading from Michael's flier] "Drugs:

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You know, sometimes I wish we just didn't have a conference room. [Kelly laughs] You know? He couldn't do that.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: But then we wouldn't have any meetings.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Okay. Bye, Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. Oh, my God, oh, my God. Hello? Yes, I am so, so sorry. Yeah, actually, I don't have that information just yet. Uh-huh. Listen, do you mind if I put you on a brief hold? Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I look forward to drug testing. I used to get a runner's high, which is why now I swim.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Why would I be worried? I'm not a drug user. I would never abuse my body like that. I mean, they are plenty of other ways to have fun. My body is 100% drug-free.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [telephone ringing] Dunder Mifflin. This is Pam. Um, hold, please. [to Jim] There's a Brenda on the phone for you. [to Brenda] Just one second, I'll transfer.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [telephone ringing] [shows note to camera "It's OK. She'll call back!"]

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: She's got it up now.

Quote.Speaker: Sheriff
Quote.Text: He'll be up. Okay, sure. I'll get someone down.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey. Hey. Jerry.

Quote.Speaker: Sheriff
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sheriff Pierce? I'm turning in my badge.

Quote.Speaker: Sheriff
Quote.Text: Where sis you get that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I got it here.

Quote.Speaker: Sheriff
Quote.Text: No. No, you didn't. we didn't give you this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, I mean at the gift shop. Also, I can't wear this anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Sheriff
Quote.Text: You were never supposed to wear this in the first place, Dwight. Come on now, seriously, you got me concerned here a little bit.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, don't worry. I never abused my power. I only tried to help the Sheriff's Department in any way I could.

Quote.Speaker: Sheriff
Quote.Text: Right, well... Why don't you give me a couple examples of ways that you've helped us out?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, God, there are so many. Roadside assistance, breaking up unruly parties, surveillance...

Quote.Speaker: Sheriff
Quote.Text: Surveillance?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Crowd control, directing traffic...

Quote.Speaker: Sheriff
Quote.Text: Mace! You... You've been carrying around weapons-grade Mace?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I've only had to use it once.

Quote.Speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #1
Quote.Text: [tosses the butt of a joint in parking lot] We should get a pizza.

Quote.Speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #2
Quote.Text: I hate pizza.
